title: Replace Coming Up with unified week timeline showing recent and upcoming
description:
Replace the current 'Coming Up' card on the dashboard with a unified chronological timeline that shows both recent meals (past few days) and upcoming meals this week, with today as the natural divider.

## Design
- Single card replacing 'Coming Up' in the existing two-column grid
- Timeline flows chronologically: recent past at top, upcoming at bottom (or vice versa — upcoming first may feel more actionable)
- Today is visually distinct as the divider/anchor point (handled by the existing TodaysMenu hero card above)
- Compact card design optimized for mobile — this is the primary use case
- Reuse the existing RecentlyCooked component logic or the useStats hook's recentlyCooked data for the 'recent' portion
- Reuse getUpcomingMeals() from useMealHistoryByDate() for the upcoming portion, filtered to this week only

## Scope
- Show ~3 days back and remainder of the current week ahead
- Each entry: dish name, cuisine badge, date label (e.g. 'Yesterday', 'Mon', 'Wed')
- Keep items compact — single line per dish where possible
- Skip today (already shown in TodaysMenu hero card)
- Empty states for both sections if no data

## Context
- Existing unused RecentlyCooked.tsx component may be a starting point
- useMealHistoryByDate() hook already provides getUpcomingMeals() and getMealsForDate()
- Primary app usage is mobile, so compact layout is critical
- This sets groundwork for upcoming user feedback features
